front.title: Listing of RPKI ROAs in JSON format (LORRI)

abstract.t: This document describes a JSON structure for listing RPKI Validated ROA Payload data. This specific structure is commonly used in the transport pipeline between RPKI Cache Validators and BGP routers, and for archival research.

note.title: Requirements Language
note.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document defines a base JSON structure for RPKI, Validated ROA Prefix (VRP) information. Functionality to export VRPs in JSON format has emerged in several implementations of relaying party (RP) software, but was not previously standardized, resulting in loose coordination between implementers. This specification establishes a simple and consistent interface for information export by RPs drawing from best practices observed in existing implementations.

t.t: LORRI files are used to distribute cryptographically validated prefix origin data from trusted caches to RPKI-to-Router servers for dissemination to routers, directly to routers, or for archival purposes.

section.title: Use of JSON
section.t: LORRI files are specified in JSON format. JSON members that are not defined here MUST NOT be used in LORRI files. A LORRI file parser MUST consider any deviations from the specifications to be errors. Future additions to the specifications in this document MUST use an incremented value for the "lorriVersion" member.

section.title: LORRI File Overview
section.t:
A LORRI consists of a single JSON object containing the following members:
A "lorriVersion" member that MUST be set to 1, encoded as a number. A "roas" member whose value is a list of objects ().
Additionnaly, a LORRI file MAY contain:
A "metadata" member whose value is an object ().

section.title: ROA
section.t:
A ROA object MUST have following members:
A "prefix" member, whose value is a string representing either an IPv4 prefix or an IPv6 prefix. An "asn" member, whose value is encoded as a number.
A ROA object MAY contain the following:
A "maxLength" member, whose value is a number equal or greater to the value of the IP mask length of the "prefix" member.
In case the "maxLength" member is absent or invalid, the value of the IP mask length of the "prefix" field must be used to interpret the ROA object.

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: The mechanisms described in this document provide a readable format that is meant to be produced by a RPKI Validator and a RTR server. The scope of action of such mechanisms are limited to the consumers of the LORRI file and do not influence other operators to interpret RPKI data. The format embeds simple cryptographic checks to ensure the data provided has not been tampered with. The operator is responsible for ensuring reliable distribution and verification of a LORRI file.
